ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] South Karana
ygData.msgSnippet: Ya might get hit by a lot of no exp greens tho.  OR however the new conning systems works. ... From: Su  To:
ygData.messageBody:
Ya might get hit by a lot of no exp greens tho. OR however the new conning
systems works.
----- Original Message -----
From: "Su" <suceress@...>
To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, November 13, 2001 2:13 AM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] South Karana


>
> Do you think a lvl 32 cleric would do ok in Runnyeye?
> luv,
> -Su
>
> > Hehe, I don't know the answer to your question about the ore, but I had
to
> > respond:
> >
> > I am so happy to find out that I am not the only Druid that hates
> dungeons.
> > Give me the wide open spaces of the Karanas, the Overthere, the
> Dreadlands,
> > or even Rathe Mts. any day. Seems like every time I venture into, say,
> > Runnyeye, Sol A, Sol B, or Lower Guk, I get killed. In fact I just got
> > de-leveled back into hell 40 this past weekend because of some nasty
> > Pickclaw Casters in the bottom level of Runnyeye. They didn't like the
> fact
> > that I was healing a level 24 warrior that wanted some Blackened Alloy,
> and
> > I was too proud to desert him to his death to save my own skin.
> >
> > Froondor
> >
> > Wood Elf Druid of 40 seasons, Tarew Marr server.
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: <MLockridge01@...>
> > To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
> > Sent: Sunday, November 11, 2001 10:36 AM
> > Subject: [EverQuest] South Karana
> >
> >
> > > I took the advice of others here and having finished my goals in EK I
> > > moved to SK. I have found the gnolls camped heavily, but while there
> > > have found Aviak Rooks wandering with sufficient frequency to be
> > > profitable. I solo them, getting about 1.5pp average in cash and
> > > loot. Not too bad, and I can pick off something else when they are
> > > too thin.
> > >
> > > Anyone know if the hq ore dropped in Runnyeye is no drop? My druid
> > > does not do that well in dungeons, so hunting up the stuff myself is
> > > not a happy prospect.
> > >
> > > Barto Proudfoot, Halfling Druid
> > >
> > >
> > >
